result.execSummary:
The defendant Raymond Fullwood Jr was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Felon Possess Firearm, a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 941.29(2)(a).
  • Felon Possess Firearm, a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 941.29(2)(a).
  • Possess w/Intent-Heroin(>10-50g), a class D felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1m)(d)3.
  • Maintain Drug Trafficking Place, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.42(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: AS TO EACH COUNT: Pay all court costs, fees, and surcharges including DNA; all applicable fees of supervision by the end of supervision. Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment. Court ordered that all court costs, fines, surcharges and/or restitution be paid through collection by the DOC's from 25% of funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b) and as a condition of ES. DOC shall collect those sums. Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civi ljudgment and/or tax intercept or other means.
AS TO EACH COUNT, CONCURRENT to any other sentence/COUNT

superMiscConds.notes:
CONDITIONS OF EXTENDED SUPERVISON:
- Obtain/maintain full time employment/education/vocation.
- No Contact with:
- Provide a DNA sample.
- Follow all rules of supervision and follow through with any other treatment deemed necessary by the department.

supervisions.notes: Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm. Court advised defendant that he may not vote until his civil rights have been restored.

**11-10-15/ Judge Timothy M Witkowiak**
The Court ordered that the JOC shall be amended by commuting the term of Initial Confinement on Count two to 18 months.
**12/2/2015 Honorable Timothy M. Witkowiak.  Court's Order of November 10, 2015 is VACATED.

*12/2/2015 Honorable Timothy M. Witkowiak.  Term of Initial Confinement commuted to 18 months on count four.

**03-15-16/Order amending JOC to reflect 2 years as to Term of ES on Count four.
**3/23/2016  Honorable Timothy M. Witkowiak presided-Initial Confinement  amended to one (1)  year.

Letter from Department of Corrections seeking review of sentence on count 4.
Sealed memorandum received and filed.
Order to Seal Document signed and filed.
Motion to Seal Document recieved and filed.

Defendant Raymond Fullwood in court with attorney Scott Alan Wales.  Megan Marie Williamson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  

Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant.  

As to Count 1:
The Court sentenced the defendant to a MAXIMUM TERM OF IMPRISONMENT of  4 YEARS with 0 days credit CONCURRENT to any other sentence/count; the INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT in the Wisconsin State Prison System is 2 YEARS; the MAXIMUM TERM OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION is 2 YEARS.

As to Count 2:
The Court sentenced the defendant to a MAXIMUM TERM OF IMPRISONMENT of  4 YEARS with 0 days credit CONCURRENT to any other sentence/count; the INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT in the Wisconsin State Prison System is 2 YEARS; the MAXIMUM TERM OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION is 2 YEARS.

As to Count 3:
The Court sentenced the defendant to a MAXIMUM TERM OF IMPRISONMENT of  10 YEARS with 0 days credit CONCURRENT to any other sentence/count; the INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT in the Wisconsin State Prison System is 5 YEARS; the MAXIMUM TERM OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION is 5 YEARS.

As to Count 4:
The Court sentenced the defendant to a MAXIMUM TERM OF IMPRISONMENT of  3 YEARS with 0 days credit CONCURRENT to any other sentence/count; the INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT in the Wisconsin State Prison System is 2 YEARS; the MAXIMUM TERM OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION is 1 YEAR.

Court finds defendant IS NOT eligible for the Challenge Incarceration program or the WI Substance Abuse program.  

Conditions of Extended Supervision:
- Obtain/maintain fulltime employment/education/vocation.
- No contact with:
- Provide a DNA sample.
- Follow all rules of supervision and follow through with any other treatment deemed necessary by the department.

Court ordered the defendant pay all of the following by the end of supervision.  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment:
All court costs, fees, and surcharges (including DNA); 
All applicable fees of supervision.
-  No Cash Bail Posted in this matter
-  Court ordered that all court costs, fines, surcharges and/or restitution be paid through collection by the Department of Corrections from 25% of funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b) and as a condition of extended supervision. DOC shall collect those sums.  Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment and/or tax intercept or other means.

Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm. 
Court advised defendant of his right to seek postconviction relief.
Court advised defendant that he may not vote until his civil rights have been restored.  

Filed:  
Written Explanation of Determinate Sentence 
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief
Letters in Support of the Defendant

Court ordered defendant REMANDED into the custody of the Milwaukee County Sheriff's Department.

Defendant Raymond Fullwood in court with attorney Scott Alan Wales.  Megan Marie Williamson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  As to Counts 1-4 defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, plead GUILTY and was examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis for the plea.  Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen deportation is possible.  Court found defendant guilty as charged in the Information and ordered entry of Judgment of Conviction.  
Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm.  Court advised defendant that his voting rights are suspended, and may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.

Case is adjourned for sentencing in Branch 22.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for October 20, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Raymond Fullwood in court with attorney Scott Alan Wales.  Megan Marie Williamson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case in court for plea hearing, however defensee requests more time.  Case remains calendared in Branch 22.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for September 10, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Raymond Fullwood in court with attorney Scott Alan Wales.  Megan Marie Williamson appeared for the State of Wisconsin./ SAB
Case calendared for PROJECTED PLEA on 8/7/2015 at 8:30 am.   Parties advised effective August 1, 2015, this case will be reassigned to Judge Witkowiak, Branch 22, Room 608 of the Courthouse.

Defendant Raymond Fullwood in court with attorney Scott Alan Wales.  Nicholas Steven Cerwin appeared on behalf of Megan Williamson for the State of Wisconsin. CMC. Original Information previously filed.  Copy previsouly given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pled not guilty. Defense requests a Status Conference. Court granted defense request. Case adjourned to branch 15.  Status conference scheduled for June 30, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Raymond Fullwood in court with attorney Scott Alan Wales.  Zachary A Wittchow appeared for the State of Wisconsin for Megan Williamson.
Request for Substitution of Judge received and filed.  Court consented to substitution against Judge Fiorenza.  Parties are advised the Clerk of Circuit Court reassigned case pursuant to current court rules to Judge Watts, Br. 15.  Court contacted Judge Watts Clerk, and next court date is adjourned for arraignment, on 6/18/2015 at 1:30 pm, branch 15.  aw  Arraignment scheduled for June 18, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Raymond Fullwood in court with attorney Scott Alan Wales.  Paul Hauer for Megan M. Williamson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Fiorenza, Branch 03.  Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading. Defense counsel requested an arraignment date. Case adjourned to Branch 3.  Arraignment scheduled for June 8, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Court ordered ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY; no possession of any firearms or weapons; and no possession of any controlled substances without a valid prescription

Defendant Raymond Fullwood in court with attorney Scott Alan Wales.  Nicholas Steven Cerwin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.    Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Fiorenza, Branch 3.  Defendant given a copy of complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT DOES NOT QUALIFY FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.   Case is adjourned for a Preliminary Hearing in Branch PE.    DEFENDANT WAS ORDERED BY THE COURT TO REPORT TO THE MILWAUKEE COUNTY JAIL (CJF) TO BE BOOKED AND RELEASED BY 3:00 P.M. ON  (05-15-2015). IF THEY FAIL TO APPEAR A BENCH WARRANT WILL BE ISSUED FOR THEIR ARREST.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for May 22, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Summons mailed.  Defendant is Out-of-Custody. Court appearance in Out-Of-Custody Court, Room 221 Safety Building on  5-14-2015 at 1:30pm
